entry.title: Re: The Re-emergence of Community in the SAP Ecosystem
entry.content:
The best parts of everything, and the most meaningful, are the unplanned parts.

  • The best part of a demo is when it doesn't work (hopefully briefly) and you have to recover.
  • The best part of a movie is not knowing how it will end.
  • The best part of a first kiss is the not knowing how the other will react.

When you come onto the TechEd floor (or to a CodeJam or other event), it's exciting not knowing exactly who you will meet, what's new in their life, what small nugget of advice or information they will give you that will help you immensely, and how you will be able to help and inspire them. 

----------------

To the post, it is tough to tell if there has been shift since the in-person are only now getting going in earnest. Still it feels more than ever, amid AI and political turmoil and uncertainty, that people want authenticity and connection and meaning -- and to just get a straight answer about how to connect their SAP BTP and on-premise/cloud systems üôÇ

P.S.: @ChrisRae Was your original post written with AI?

entry.title: Re: Welcome SAP-RPT-1! What is it? How can you try it out?
entry.content:
A prediction (estimate) has at least two dimensions. The best guess value and how certain are you about that value. I would argue that the most important of these is the last one, which can be indicated by for instance 10-percentile and 90-percentile numbers.

If I am wondering how many Luke Skywalker christmas tree ornaments to order for my online shop my actions based on a best guess of 505 with a range of 501 to 513 would be quite different from my actions based on a best guess of 505 with a range of 103 to 7840. How can (or does) RPT-1 indicate the certainty of the predictions?

From what I have seen in the playground (admittedly haven't spent an hour there yet) it's single value prediction, best guess, most likely value, or 50-percentile estimate - whatever you want to call it.

entry.title: Preference determination for Configurable Bills of Material based on sales orders
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

We have GTSe4H system and use configurable bill of material (based on sales orders) to determine preference.
Result of preference determination is 'Affected by Price', and a threshold value is calculated, correctly.
But when we try to issue Long Term Supplier Declaration (LTSD) to customer, it does not consider the threshold value for comparison with price from the invoice.  In fact, the billing document shows statistical value (which is 0) although preference value is available for the billing invoice. 
Questions:
- Can we issue LTSD for configurable bills of materials (based on sales orders)
- Why is the statistical value considered for the invoice instead of preference value?
- Are the results from preference determination only visible in the 'Preference Determination Logs' and not stored somewhere like in the product master?
Any inputs would be highly appreciated

Thank you

entry.title: Re: FSM activity assignment and control via org levels
entry.content:
Good morning,

I played around a bit with the organization levels around one year ago. Here are some details I can share:

  • All DTOs have fields "orgLevel" (string) and "orgLevelIds" (array) in the database. Both fields can not be maintained via screens, but with the help of business rules or the related API.
  • Both fields work with the IDs of the organization levels. They can be read via the Org Level API. CAUTION: If you set the ID in one of the mentioned DTO fields, you must delete the '-'.
  • Read models in the policy groups can help limit the data access in the planning board, planning list, service calls and activities. On the service maps, the activities were visible, but the details could not be displayed.
  • You can connect the organization level with the regions you can maintain in the settings and configuration area. For example: A technician assigned to region "Germany" can only access data of organization "ABCDE". In case the technician creates a new service call, a business rule flags this call with the organization ID "ABCDE".

Honestly, I did not use this in a customer project so far. But probably, this gives you an idea how to realize this.

Best regards,

Christoph

entry.title: Create Billing for Service ID
entry.content:
Question‚ÄÉ:
During the billing process, the Service ID maintained in the service order does not appear as a billing item. Instead, the system displays the material assigned in the DIP Profile, rather than the actual Service ID from the service order.
What is the correct SAP standard configuration that allows the Service ID recorded in the service order to appear as the billing item, instead of the material derived from the DIP Profile?

Current (As-Is) Condition‚ÄÉ:
When creating a billing document for a Service Order, the item that appears in the billing document is ‚ÄúMaterial as Service‚Äù, rather than the Service ID maintained in the service order.

I have already tried entering the activity number / service ID in the ‚ÄúSource‚Äù field under the Set Name column, so that it would appear as the activity number / service ID during billing and quotation. However, this approach still does not work.

I forgot to mentioned that this issue also happened in quotation. process as well.

Best regards,
Ester Wang

entry.title: Initiating SAP Demo Environment
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are new to the SAP environment. We are considering building an application that is retrieving the business data from existing SAP servers owned by our company's clients. However, after looking through the guidance and tutorials, we are still not sure about what necessary steps we should take.
Therefore, we would like to ask these questions:

  1. We want to build a demo/test environment to retrieve transaction data from SAP servers owned by our clients. Is it possible to simply call APIs from those servers from a third party App?

  2. If number 1 is not possible, could we do that by setting up Business One/BTP servers which will be called by our application (might be treated as the 3rd party apps from the SAP point of view) as bridging agent between our client's SAP server and our application? Can we have the guidance on how we set up SAP Business One/BTP demo environment servers?

  3. Also, is it possible to build a demo environment of SAP server that simulates our client's SAP server? (Please correct us if there's any misunderstanding concept regarding SAP)

Currently, we have provision SAP CLOUD PLATFORM installation and  SAP Business Technology Platform software. We are not sure whether our current setup is correct based on the aforementioned goals we have. So, we would really appreciate it if you could guide us to the correct steps. Many thanks!

entry.title: Re: ODBC for ABAP error returning Non-ASCII characters
entry.content:
Just provinding myself the solution to the topics I mentioned.

1). iusql cannot return non-ASCII characters as it never was meant to do so. See iusql code which converts unicode to ASCII (no matter which option you provide in .odbc.ini)

2). UseWChar=1 in the ODBC driver properties will return proper Unicode in your consuming app

Question can be closed.

Cheers

entry.title: How to Import Data from Customized Tables into Group Reporting
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently implementing Group Reporting. On the FICO side, there are customized tables that reside within the same SAP S/4HANA environment as Group Reporting and do not post data back into the ACDOCA table.

We are considering the following options:

Option 1: Use OData services and import data via GRDC. This would involve exporting data to GRDC (SAP BTP) and then sending it back to S/4HANA.

Option 2: Use the API for reported data to write reported data to posting level 00. For this option, we still have questions:

  • Does the API only support data exchange between an external client system and S/4HANA, or can it also be used for reading data internally between S/4HANA components in the same environment?

Question:
Are there any suggestions or any other recommended approaches for importing data from these customized tables into ACDOCU? For example, using an API, BAdI, or any other standard method?

Thank you for your guidance and support in advance!

entry.title: Re: Trigger a process in SAP Build Process Automation from SAP Build Apps without using API
entry.content:
@KlausPeng Is this still relevant? Generally, the issue nowadays is that Build Apps flow functions were designed when there were no shared environments, and only work if you are triggering a process in Public (which of course is deprecated).

See this blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/triggering-process-in-shared-environment-from-sap-build-apps-better/ba-p/14183502

entry.title: Re: Introducing the Gantt Chart Custom Widget for SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Good morning::

I kindly suggest you take a close look at the post above, which lays out many if not all of the details.

Brief summary:
 - Create a regular table widget bound to your query.
 - Populate the custom widget with the Result set as shown below

var tasksResultSet = Table_Tasks.getDataSource().getResultSet();
GanttChart_1.setDataSet(tasksResultSet);

 - Map the columns from your table to the custom widget.

Feel free to come back with detailed questions.

Thank you.

entry.title: Building an SAP-RPT-1 "Hello World" with AI Core
entry.content:
Using SAP-RPT-1 in the playground is a nice way to get a first impression, but you'll soon realize there are some limitations. In this blog post, let's explore how to use SAP-RPT-1 in a production-like environment. I'll walk you through the steps to build a simple "Hello World" application using SAP-RPT-1 and AI Core.

 
 

Creating a Deployment for SAP-RPT-1

Throughout this blog post, I'll assume that you have access to a BTP subaccount with instances of the AI Core service (extended plan) and the AI Launchpad service (standard plan).

First, you need to create a configuration for SAP-RPT-1 with the following parameters:

  • Configuration Name: For example, sap-rpt-1-large or sap-rpt-1-small (I recommend naming the configuration so that you can easily recognize the underlying model)
  • Scenario: foundation-models
  • Version: 0.0.1 (default value)
  • Executable: aicore-sap (meaning that this model is hosted by SAP; you can find this value in note 3437766)
  • Model Name: sap-rpt-1-large or sap-rpt-1-small (again, as per note 3437766)
  • Model Version: latest

In the next step, you can turn this configuration into a deployment by clicking on the "Create Deployment" button in the configuration overview. You can leave all the default values as they are and create the deployment.

After a few minutes, the deployment should reach the status "Running" and you can start using it. Note that a deployment URL has also been created, something like https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2/inference/deployments/1234567890abcdef. The most important part is the deployment ID at the end of the URL (in this example 1234567890abcdef), which you'll need later on.

 
 

Handling AI Core Authentication

At the time of writing, the SAP Cloud SDK for Python does not yet support the RPT-1 models. Following the documentation, we will therefore use the requests library to call the deployment endpoint directly.

Before we can do that, however, we need to authenticate as also described in the documentation. What may look intimidating at first is actually quite straightforward. We only need a few parameters which we'll store securely in a .env file. You can collect this information from the service key of your AI Core instance.

AICORE_API_URL="https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2"
AICORE_AUTH_URL="https://a1b2c3d4e4f61234.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com" # called "url" in the service key
AICORE_CLIENT_ID="sb-95d9f03d" # shortened, yours will be longer
AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET="c51ad55c"  # shortened, yours will be longer
AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP="default"  # your actual resource group

Additionally, store the RPT deployment ID(s) you collected earlier:

RPT1L_DEPLOYMENT_ID="1234567890abcdef"  # your actual deployment ID for RPT-1 large
RPT1S_DEPLOYMENT_ID="abcdef1234567890"  # your actual deployment ID for RPT-1 small

Once the .env file is ready, we can use the following code to retrieve an access token from the authentication endpoint:

 
#!pip install python-dotenv # install if not already installed
 
import os
import requests
from dotenv import load_dotenv

# Load .env file
load_dotenv()

AICORE_AUTH_URL = os.environ["AICORE_AUTH_URL"]
AICORE_CLIENT_ID = os.environ["AICORE_CLIENT_ID"]
AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET = os.environ["AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET"]

token_url = f"{AICORE_AUTH_URL}/oauth/token"

response = requests.post(
    token_url,
    auth=(AICORE_CLIENT_ID, AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET),
    data={"grant_type": "client_credentials"},
)

response.raise_for_status()

token_data = response.json()
access_token = token_data["access_token"]
 
 

Preparing Test Data

For testing the connection to the RPT-1 deployment, we'll use the same test data we used when trying out RPT-1 in the playground. Here's the test data in the format RPT-1 expects:

Note: For the next steps, I also created a Jupyter notebook, which you can download to interactively do all the steps below yourself.

 
payload = {
    "prediction_config": {
        "target_columns": [
            {
                "name": "SALESGROUP",
                "prediction_placeholder": "[PREDICT]"
                # "task_type": "classification" or "regression" can be specified here if needed
            }
        ]
    },
    "index_column": "ID",
    "rows": [
        {
            "ID": "1001",
            "PRODUCT": "Tablet",
            "PRICE": 599.00,
            "CUSTOMER": "TechStart Inc",
            "COUNTRY": "USA",
            "SALESGROUP": "[PREDICT]"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1002",
            "PRODUCT": "Standing Desk",
            "PRICE": 325.50,
            "CUSTOMER": "Workspace Solutions",
            "COUNTRY": "Germany",
            "SALESGROUP": "[PREDICT]"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1003",
            "PRODUCT": "Workstation",
            "PRICE": 1450.00,
            "CUSTOMER": "Enterprise Systems Ltd",
            "COUNTRY": "Canada",
            "SALESGROUP": "Enterprise Solutions"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1004",
            "PRODUCT": "Laptop Pro",
            "PRICE": 1899.99,
            "CUSTOMER": "Business Corp",
            "COUNTRY": "UK",
            "SALESGROUP": "Enterprise Solutions"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1005",
            "PRODUCT": "Gaming Laptop",
            "PRICE": 1250.00,
            "CUSTOMER": "Digital Ventures",
            "COUNTRY": "USA",
            "SALESGROUP": "Enterprise Solutions"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1006",
            "PRODUCT": "Smart Watch",
            "PRICE": 299.99,
            "CUSTOMER": "Gadget Store",
            "COUNTRY": "Australia",
            "SALESGROUP": "Consumer Electronics"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1007",
            "PRODUCT": "Ergonomic Chair",
            "PRICE": 445.00,
            "CUSTOMER": "Office Outfitters",
            "COUNTRY": "France",
            "SALESGROUP": "Office Furniture"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1008",
            "PRODUCT": "Storage Array",
            "PRICE": 3500.00,
            "CUSTOMER": "CloudTech Systems",
            "COUNTRY": "Singapore",
            "SALESGROUP": "Data Infrastructure"
        },
        {
            "ID": "1009",
            "PRODUCT": "Network Switch",
            "PRICE": 175.50,
            "CUSTOMER": "ConnectIT",
            "COUNTRY": "Japan",
            "SALESGROUP": "Networking Devices"
        }
    ]
}
 
 

For better readability, here is the data in table format:

 
import pandas as pd

sample_data = pd.DataFrame(payload["rows"])
sample_data
 
  ID PRODUCT PRICE CUSTOMER COUNTRY SALESGROUP012345678
1001Tablet599.00TechStart IncUSA[PREDICT]
1002Standing Desk325.50Workspace SolutionsGermany[PREDICT]
1003Workstation1450.00Enterprise Systems LtdCanadaEnterprise Solutions
1004Laptop Pro1899.99Business CorpUKEnterprise Solutions
1005Gaming Laptop1250.00Digital VenturesUSAEnterprise Solutions
1006Smart Watch299.99Gadget StoreAustraliaConsumer Electronics
1007Ergonomic Chair445.00Office OutfittersFranceOffice Furniture
1008Storage Array3500.00CloudTech SystemsSingaporeData Infrastructure
1009Network Switch175.50ConnectITJapanNetworking Devices
 
 

Running the predictions

To run the predictions, we will use the requests library to send an HTTP POST request to the RPT-1 deployment endpoint. The request will include our test data and the authorization token.

 
AICORE_API_URL = os.environ["AICORE_API_URL"].rstrip("/")
AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP = os.environ.get("AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP", "default")
RPT1_DEPLOYMENT_ID = os.environ.get("RPT1L_DEPLOYMENT_ID")

if not RPT1_DEPLOYMENT_ID:
    raise ValueError("Missing RPT1L_DEPLOYMENT_ID in .env (deployment id from AI Launchpad).")

url = f"{AICORE_API_URL}/inference/deployments/{RPT1_DEPLOYMENT_ID}/predict"

headers = {
    "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
    "AI-Resource-Group": AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP,
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=120)
response.raise_for_status()
 
 

Analyzing the results

Let's take a look at the results returned by RPT-1. Here are the predictions in the raw JSON format:

 
import json

data = response.json()
preds = data["predictions"]
print(json.dumps(preds, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False))
 
[
  {
    "ID": 1001,
    "SALESGROUP": [
      {
        "confidence": 0.93,
        "prediction": "Enterprise Solutions"
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    "ID": 1002,
    "SALESGROUP": [
      {
        "confidence": 0.78,
        "prediction": "Office Furniture"
      }
    ]
  }
]
 
 

Note that the result looks different from what we saw in the playground, which hosts the RPT-1-OSS model. RPT-1-Large also returns a confidence score for each prediction.

Let's merge these predictions back into the tabular format to see the results more clearly:

 
preds_df = sample_data.copy(deep=True)

preds_df["ID"] = preds_df["ID"].astype(int)

for pred in preds:
    row_idx = int(pred["ID"])
    predicted_value = pred["SALESGROUP"][0]["prediction"]
    preds_df.loc[preds_df["ID"] == row_idx, "SALESGROUP"] = predicted_value

preds_df
 
  ID PRODUCT PRICE CUSTOMER COUNTRY SALESGROUP012345678
1001Tablet599.00TechStart IncUSAEnterprise Solutions
1002Standing Desk325.50Workspace SolutionsGermanyOffice Furniture
1003Workstation1450.00Enterprise Systems LtdCanadaEnterprise Solutions
1004Laptop Pro1899.99Business CorpUKEnterprise Solutions
1005Gaming Laptop1250.00Digital VenturesUSAEnterprise Solutions
1006Smart Watch299.99Gadget StoreAustraliaConsumer Electronics
1007Ergonomic Chair445.00Office OutfittersFranceOffice Furniture
1008Storage Array3500.00CloudTech SystemsSingaporeData Infrastructure
1009Network Switch175.50ConnectITJapanNetworking Devices
 
 

For comparison, here is the original sample data before predictions:

 
sample_data
 
  ID PRODUCT PRICE CUSTOMER COUNTRY SALESGROUP012345678
1001Tablet599.00TechStart IncUSA[PREDICT]
1002Standing Desk325.50Workspace SolutionsGermany[PREDICT]
1003Workstation1450.00Enterprise Systems LtdCanadaEnterprise Solutions
1004Laptop Pro1899.99Business CorpUKEnterprise Solutions
1005Gaming Laptop1250.00Digital VenturesUSAEnterprise Solutions
1006Smart Watch299.99Gadget StoreAustraliaConsumer Electronics
1007Ergonomic Chair445.00Office OutfittersFranceOffice Furniture
1008Storage Array3500.00CloudTech SystemsSingaporeData Infrastructure
1009Network Switch175.50ConnectITJapanNetworking Devices
 
 

Conclusion

We've successfully transitioned from using SAP-RPT-1 in the playground to deploying and using it via AI Core. This setup allows you to use RPT-1 in a scalable, production-like environment. On the playground, for example, you quickly hit limits if you try more complex scenarios or larger datasets. Using a deployment via AI Core overcomes these limitations.

I already have quite a few ideas for building more complex applications using RPT-1 and AI Core. Which scenarios will you build first? Let me know in the comments!

entry.title: Re: Ant initialize error for SAP Commerce on-prem 2205.44
entry.content:
In 2205.44, Ant expects Rush to already exist, but under some conditions it is not bootstrapped before invocation, leading to:

Invoking "rush update --bypass-policy"
The system cannot find the path specified.

It may have worked on 2211.37 beccause Rush was either already present from previous install, or Ant bootstrapped it correctly before calling it.

In 2205.44 it looks like Ant target calls rush update before ensuring node_modules/.bin/rush.cmd exists. So Ant literally tries to execute a file that isn‚Äôt there yet. Check if you have the following file after the error . It may not exist:-

hybris\bin\modules\smartedit\smartedittools\common\node_modules\.bin\rush.cmd.


You may try to manually bootstrap smartedit tooling by installing Rush .

Testing:

entry.title: Re: Welcome SAP-RPT-1! What is it? How can you try it out?
entry.content:
That is a very good question and based on my knowledge it completely depends on the token count given to the transformer as an input and also the parameter count of the transformer that is processing the input. I am not sure about RPT-1 in general, but from what I have learned about LLMs in general, the quality of the result for the single value prediction depends a lot on the total available data that is used to train the data. To address your question of how would the guess be for range of 103-7840, I feel the better the model is trained with enough tokens from the input side for each token in the transformer's end, the better the output prediction is going to be. It was beautifully explained in the Chinchilla's law where it states, for a fixed compute budget, you should not just make models bigger, you should also give them a lot more data. 


Do check it out to know more in detail: https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/artificial-intelligence/chinchilla-scaling-laws/

Apologies for any typos.

entry.title: Re: Welcome SAP-RPT-1! What is it? How can you try it out?
entry.content: @KjetilKilhavn: Indeed, this is a very valid point. It seems that the RPT-1-OSS model in the playground only returns the prediction, without the confidence (as shown above, it is null). The models available on AI Core (SAP-RPT-1-Small and SAP-RPT-1-Large) do return the confidence as well. You can see this extended behavior in this blog post: Building an SAP-RPT-1 "Hello World" with AI Core

entry.title: Re: How to check authroization header in iFlow
entry.content:
There are a few things to consider:

  • standard authorization/Authorization header (both contain the same value) is hidden by default for security purposes, but you can pass its value via content modifier to a custom header or property to make it visible
  • Remember to assign Data Type as java.lang.String, otherwise, it may contain unwanted values like org.apache.camel.converter.stream.InputStreamCache or org.apache.camel.converter.stream.ByteArrayInputStreamCache
  • Remember to allowlist Authorization in the iFlow runtime configuration
  • Based on my observations, when sender calls via Basic Auth, this value is present, but when the source system calls via OAuth, the header contains empty value. Let me know if you experience the same behavior. In any case, this is sufficient to identify whether the iFlow is called via Basic Auth or OAuth üôÇ

BR

Mateusz

entry.title: Re: Error when updating a user's default layout
entry.content:
Please see details below for your reference on why user encounter the error on "This entry already exists in the following tables 'Document Standards' (RDFL) (ODBC -2035) [Message 131-183]".
  • Before you change the default, other form has been set previously as the default for the current user and all BPs which for example is the Layout 1.
  • Changing the default to for example Layout 2 by using the checkbox as well for "Set as Default for all BPs (for Whom a Default Layout Has Not Been Assigned)" will not override the previous default of Layout 1. To be able to successfully change, user will need to perform the following:
  1. Select the existing default.
  2. Click on Set as Default
  3. Tick the Set as Default for Specified BP
  4. Click Clear button.
  5. Click Update
  6. Click OK
  7. Click OK
  8. Click Update.
  • Then you can now proceed to change the default by using the "Set as Default for all BPs (for Whom a Default Layout Has Not Been Assigned)".

entry.title: Re: I cannot TECO the production order because open outbo...
entry.content:
Someone have done the GI (261 movement) from S4 instead of doing it from the EWM. This cause the issue.
It seems they don't have that mapping for the item type in the Outbound Delivery which is why it is getting stuck in EWM. So what we can do is to delete/cancel the delivery in S/4. 

You can check the deliveries in LIPS table, filter using the Process Order number. 

Reset the Distrib Status of the delivery in S/4 - go to SE37, execute /SPE/DELV_RESET_DIST_STATUS. Input the Outbound Delivery number in IT_DELIVERY_KEYS - VBELN. Then execute. 

Go to VL02N and input the outbound delivery number, then delete

entry.title: Re: OOTB Cache regions issue
entry.content:
Hello SukanyaM

Check if the cache is globally disabled at runtime . Even if properties are the same, CCv2 / dev / stage environments often disable cache via JVM flags or env vars.
check in hac->configuration for properties like xxx.cache.enabled and check if those are true

If it is false, all cache regions exist but are never used, resulting in:

Hits = 0

Misses = 0

Invalidations still increase.

Once you set these properties to true, restart the nodes.

entry.title: Re: SAP BAdI ME_GUI_PO_CUST: How to Prevent '0' from Disp...
entry.content: @3253405293 it is basically about creating two function modules CONVERSION_EXIT_xxxxx_INPUT and CONVERSION_EXIT_xxxxx_OUTPUT, where xxxxx is your routine name (use Z/Y namespace for this). You can check your system for CONVERSION_EXIT_Z* functions (if there are any) to get idea. And there are articles and forum posts about this if you try search.

entry.title: Modernize Planning: Universal Hierarchy in SAP Revenue Growth Management for SAP Cloud ERP Customers
entry.content:
1. Navigating Hierarchy Complexity

For emerging consumer products companies, managing customer and product hierarchies is a fundamental challenge for commercial planning. This complexity is inherent to the fast-moving industry, where product portfolios evolve with new launches and discontinuations, customer organizations restructure, and planning cycles need to align with diverse retailer calendars. System administrators and Key Account Managers (KAMs) alike face the challenge of ensuring data consistency, planning accuracy, and operational efficiency amidst these changes. Traditional approaches often lead to manual, error-prone adjustments and a constant game of catch-up.

For customers adopting SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the introduction of the Universal Hierarchy Framework in SAP Revenue Growth Management addresses these pain points, offering a time-aware, unified, and streamlined approach to hierarchy management.

 

2. Universal Hierarchy Framework: A Future-Proof Foundation for Revenue Growth

SAP Revenue Growth Management is designed to empower CPG companies with robust tools for account planning, promotion management, and analytics. A critical capability for customers of SAP Cloud ERP is the Universal Hierarchy Framework. We now support both customer and product hierarchies that are time-dependent and versioned‚Äîcapable of consuming SAP Public Cloud's Universal Hierarchy Framework. This means customers now have a future-proof way to manage hierarchies, transforming them as time-aware assets for promotion planning and execution.

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

 

3. Key Functionalities of Universal Hierarchy Framework in SAP Revenue Growth Management

3.1. Plan Ahead with Confidence: Time-Dependent Hierarchies

The ability to plan hierarchy changes in advance is a foundational benefit of the Universal Hierarchy Framework provided by SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, which SAP Revenue Growth Management now supports. Unlike traditional hierarchies where updates take effect immediately, the Universal Hierarchy Framework allows system admins or KAMs to define validity periods for both customer and product hierarchies. This means users can plan and schedule entire hierarchy changes‚Äîsuch as a sales region reorganization or a new product category introduction‚Äîwell in advance, with changes becoming effective automatically on a specified date.

  • Proactive Workflow Alignment

According to user research, portfolio reviews and hierarchy changes are typically planned months in advance. With the Universal Hierarchy Framework, users can set up all necessary changes far in advance for the next planning year‚Äîand avoid end-of-year rushes before the holiday season, directly aligning system updates with strategic business cycles.

  • Reduced Operational Risk

By allowing changes to be scheduled and automatically activated, system admins and KAMs significantly reduce the risk of errors or missed updates during critical periods, ensuring that planning and execution always reflect the intended future organizational reality.

 

3.2. Unified View: Managing Multi‚ÄëVersion Product Hierarchies in a Single Screen

Businesses rarely operate on a single, fixed product hierarchy version for a long period of time. The Universal Hierarchy Framework recognizes this reality by supporting multiple time‚Äëbound product hierarchy versions. SAP Revenue Growth Management introduces a unified view ‚Äî a one‚Äëscreen user experience that presents all relevant hierarchy versions on a single screen. This allows KAMs to view and select products or categories across different hierarchy versions without switching contexts, ensuring a complete and continuous planning overview.

One-Screen Transparency

  • Workflow: For example, in a 2026 ready meals account plan, ‚Äúsalad‚Äù belongs to product hierarchy A (PH A) in the first half of the year, and ‚Äúpizza‚Äù is introduced in the latter half under product hierarchy B (PH B). When a KAM plans a promotion for both items, they need to access them on one screen.
  • A Unified View: By default, the UI primarily displays the earliest valid hierarchy version (e.g. PH A) for the selected planning period. Users are notified that multiple hierarchy versions are available and can switch between versions on the same page. This one-screen view, validated by user research, reduces navigation effort and prevents confusion associated with managing disjointed views.

 

 

Uninterrupted Focus for Informed Business Decisions

  • Workflow: If a KAM views PH B, which excludes "salad", they can still find "salad" in the Product Categories in Other Versions section. When the KAM selects ‚Äúsalad‚Äù and switches to PH A where "salad" exists, the UI keeps the selection valid, allowing planning to continue without interruption.
  • Informed Decision-Making: KAMs can identify changes and understand where products sit in the hierarchy structure during a given planning period, providing valuable context for business decisions.
  • Uninterrupted Planning: Product selection remains valid when switching between versions, reducing toggling and keeping KAMs focused on planning tasks.

 

 

3.3. Streamlined Selection: The Fully Expanded Flat List

When users need speed and efficiency‚Äîespecially for customer selection‚Äîa flat list that presents all available options at a single, non-nested level, is often more effective than a tree structure. In SAP Revenue Growth Management, customer selection uses a fully expanded flat list to speed search and selection.

  • Quick, Effortless Navigation

KAMs looking for a specific customer no longer need to drill down through multiple tree structures. In promotion planning, choosing correct customers quickly is often more critical than understanding the full customer tree. With the flat list, KAMs can search, filter, select, and continue‚Äîkeeping focus on core planning objectives. This simplification is backed by user research and aligns with natural user behavior.

  • All Options Expanded at Fingertips

Within SAP Revenue Growth Management, flat lists are presented fully expanded by default, enabling users to see all selectable items at once. This creates a simple, efficient experience and is accompanied by search and filter capabilities for productivity.

 

4. Co-Innovation: Shape Universal Hierarchy Management

The introduction of Universal Hierarchy Framework is a significant step in enabling customers on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to utilize SAP Revenue Growth Management. By providing time-dependent hierarchies, unified multi-version views, and streamlined selection experiences, we aim to help emerging small and medium-sized companies in the consumer product industry to stay agile and competitive in a rapidly changing market.

If you're an existing or a prospective customer of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you're more than welcome to join our co-innovation for Universal Hierarchies. Contact us today at RGM_Engage@sap.com to start the journey toward modernizing your trade promotion management and embracing a more agile approach to planning.

 

Final Note: The support for Universal Hierarchies in SAP Revenue Growth Management is scheduled to become available in January 2026, in support of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Secure your spot as a co-innovation partner today and let‚Äôs drive your revenue growth.

 

More Information

Documentation on SAP Help Portal

Topic Page for SAP Revenue Growth Management

    • Introducing Calendar View in SAP Revenue Growth Management: A Visual Leap for Strategic Planning
    • Decoding Promotional Success: Embedded Analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Unlocking Trade Spend Control Efficiency with Funds Management in SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs Account Plan
    • Elevate Your Promotion Strategy: Baseline Management with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
    • Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Financial Execution & Claims for Trade Promotions with SAP Revenue Growth Management & SAP Cloud ERP
    • Master Your KPIs: How SAP Revenue Growth Management Boosts Data-Driven Growth 
    • Modernize Planning: Universal Hierarchy in SAP Revenue Growth Management for SAP Cloud ERP Customers

entry.title: Re: Adding where condition in CDS extension
entry.content:
Good day @dhina_007

The public cloud does not allow you to link your custom CDS view to replace the data source of any Fiori app (in your case Display Line Items in General Ledger). So, you cannot swap them in public cloud because they are pre-delivered.

What you can do depends on what your goal is.

There are a few options you may consider:

  • Is to use the standard filter and save a variant if you only need the filter
  • Is to try key user UI adaptation if Document Type is not offered in the filter bar
  • Build your own app or report and publish it as a tile.

What exactly is your goal?

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: The Date Is Technically Correct‚Ä¶ but HR Is Still Not Happy
entry.content:
‚ÄúThe Date Is Technically Correct‚Ä¶ but HR Is Still Not Happy‚Äù

A Practical How-To for Resignation and Last Working Date Logic in SAP SuccessFactors EC

It usually starts with a resignation case that looks harmless.

The system shows a date.
Payroll confirms the calculation.
Technically, everything is correct.

And then HR says:

‚ÄúThis is not how resignations work in real life.‚Äù

If you‚Äôve implemented SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, you‚Äôve heard this before. Especially during UAT. Especially when exits, notice periods, and payroll deadlines are involved.

This how-to article explains how to fix one of the most common ‚Äî and most underestimated ‚Äî gaps in EC:
Date of Resignation and Last Working Date logic when time, weekends, and notice periods collide.

 

Why This Problem Shows Up in Almost Every EC Project

Out of the box, Employee Central treats dates exactly as dates.

  • A resignation submitted on Sunday is still Sunday
  • A resignation submitted at 6:31 PM is still ‚Äútoday‚Äù
  • A notice period end date can land on a weekend without any warning

From a system point of view, nothing is wrong.
From a business point of view, this causes confusion, rework, and manual overrides.

HR teams think in:

  • Working days
  • Office cut-off times
  • Payroll processing realities

This how-to focuses on aligning system logic with business reality.

 

Business Requirement (What We Are Solving)

Date of Resignation (DOR)

  • If an employee submits resignation after 6:30 PM IST, the system should consider the next working day as the effective Date of Resignation.
  • If an employee submits resignation on Saturday or Sunday, the system should automatically move the Date of Resignation to the first working day.

Last Working Date (LWD) as per Notice Period

  • LWD should be calculated as:
    Date of Resignation + Required Days of Notice (calendar days)
  • If the calculated LWD falls on a weekend, it should move to the next working day.

 

System Assumptions (Critical)

Before building the rules, confirm the following:

  • Module: SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
  • System Locale: EN_US
  • Business Time Zone: IST
  • Working Days: Monday to Friday
  • Working Hours Cut-off: 18:30 IST
  • Notice Period Type: Calendar days

Even though the system locale is EN_US, resignation timing must follow IST working hours.
This detail is often missed ‚Äî and causes most after-hours issues.

 

Solution Design (Recommended Approach)

To keep the logic stable and easy to explain during UAT, the solution is split into two independent EC Business Rules:

  1. Date of Resignation Adjustment Rule
  2. Last Working Date as per Notice Period Rule

Each rule has a clear responsibility and does not interfere with the other.

 

Rule 1: Adjust Date of Resignation

(After Hours & Weekend Handling)

Purpose

Ensure the effective Date of Resignation always falls on a working day.

Rule Setup

  • Scenario: Trigger onChange Rules for HRIS Elements
  • Base Object: Employment Details
  • Execution: On Change
  • Field: Date of Resignation

Logic Overview

  1. Convert system DateTime to IST using UTC offset (5.5).
  2. If time is on or after 18:30 IST, shift DOR to the next day.
  3. Check day of week:
    • Saturday ‚Üí add 2 days
    • Sunday ‚Üí add 1 day

Outcome

The system stores a business-valid Date of Resignation, not just the submission date.

 

 

Rule 2: Calculate Last Working Date as per Notice Period

Purpose

Calculate LWD correctly and prevent it from falling on a weekend.

Rule Setup

  • Scenario: Trigger onChange Rules for HRIS Elements
  • Base Object: Employment Details
  • Execution: On Change
  • Trigger Fields:
    • Date of Resignation
    • Required Days of Notice

Step 1: Provisional LWD

Provisional LWD = Date of Resignation + Required Days of Notice

This uses calendar days, as defined by policy.

Step 2: Weekend Validation

  • Saturday ‚Üí add 2 days
  • Sunday ‚Üí add 1 day
  • Weekday ‚Üí no change

Outcome

The final Last Working Date as per Notice Period always lands on a working day.

 

 

 

 

Important Detail: How Notice Period Is Counted

This is where most confusion happens.

In SuccessFactors:

  • When you add calendar days, the Date of Resignation is already included.

Example

  • Effective Date of Resignation: 15-Dec-2025
  • Required Days of Notice: 45

Correct system result:

  • Last Working Date = 28-Jan-2026

Adding one extra day here would be incorrect.

 

End-to-End Test Scenario

Input

  • Date of Resignation entered: 14-Dec-2025 (Sunday)
  • Required Days of Notice: 45
  • Submission time: After 6:30 PM IST

System Result

  1. Effective DOR ‚Üí 15-Dec-2025 (Monday)
  2. Provisional LWD ‚Üí 28-Jan-2026
  3. Weekend check ‚Üí Not required

Final Values

  • Date of Resignation: 15-Dec-2025
  • Last Working Date as per NP: 28-Jan-2026

 

 

Rule Assignment Summary

Rule

Field

Execution

DOR Adjustment Rule

Date of Resignation

On Change

LWD Calculation Rule

Last Working Date as per NP

On Change

This sequencing avoids circular updates and ensures consistent behaviour.

 

Key Takeaways

  • Normalize Date of Resignation first
  • Separate resignation timing logic from notice period logic
  • EN_US locale does not imply US working hours
  • Weekend handling must be explicit in EC
  • Small date errors create big HR trust issues

 

Closing Note

Resignation logic is one of those areas where the system is judged not by its features, but by its judgment.

When dates behave the way HR expects, no one notices.
When they don‚Äôt, everyone does.

Getting this right is less about complex configuration and more about understanding how business actually works.

entry.title: How to Register Accounting Document When Taxes Apply Using the BO Interface (I_JOURNALENTRYTP)
entry.content:
Utilities: 4,000 yen / Cash: 4,400 yen
Provisional Consumption Tax: 400 yen /
When registering an accounting document using ‚ÄúI_JOURNALENTRYTP‚Äù,

Which structure should be used for passing the data?

Registration succeeded without a tax code. However, when a voucher exists, an error occurs stating ‚ÄúNo withholding tax statement details for tax code V3(10%)‚Äù.

Since this is for utilities, withholding tax is not required.

I wrote the code based on the BO in the link below.


https://hub.sap.com/bointerface/I_JOURNALENTRYTP

I would be grateful if you could tell me.

        APPEND INITIAL LINE TO lt_je_deep ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_deep>).

         <fs_deep>-%cid = lv_cid.
         <fs_deep>-%param = VALUE #(
         companycode = '1510'                        "‰ºöÁ§æ„Ç≥„Éº„Éâ
         businesstransactiontype = 'RFBU'            "ÂèñÂºï„Çø„Ç§„Éó
         accountingdocumenttype = 'AB'               "‰ºùÁ•®„Çø„Ç§„Éó
         createdbyuser = sy-uname                    "ÁôªÈå≤ËÄÖ
         documentdate = '20251217'                   "‰ºùÁ•®Êó•‰ªò
         postingdate = '20251217'                    "Ëª¢Ë®òÊó•‰ªò
         accountingdocumentheadertext = 'BOtest'     "‰ºùÁ•®„Éò„ÉÉ„ÉÄ„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà
         TaxDeterminationDate =  '20251217'          "Á®éÈáëÊ±∫ÂÆöÊó•

        _glitems = VALUE #(
          ( glaccountlineitem = |001| glaccount = '10010000'
          _currencyamount = VALUE #( ( currencyrole = '00' journalentryitemamount = '-100.55' currency = 'JPY' ) ) )
          ( glaccountlineitem = |002| glaccount = '63001000' taxcode = 'V3' costcenter = '15101801'
          _currencyamount = VALUE #( ( currencyrole = '00' journalentryitemamount = '100.55' currency = 'JPY' ) ) ) )

        ).

ABAP Cloud SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance

entry.title: Re: Task completion only by task owner in QM12
entry.content:
Greetings,

entry.title: Re: Managing Vehicles in SAP Asset Management and SAP SSAM
entry.content:
Greetings,

you culd look into SAP fleet management solution:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/e98c7c41bbe8439e90daa5c114a7573b/0e7bbb53707db44ce10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US

It includes some additional functionalioties such as automatic fuel consumtion etc.

But overall vehicles are no different than any other equipment. You need to define which EAM processes are relevant for this type of technical object and explore the possibilities in scope of standard EAM functionalities (preventive, corrective, reactive, ...).

You would want to separate these objects by special equipment type, store additional data in a class and classify the individual equipment and you probably also want to have counters to track kilometers and trigger preventive maintenance based on that.

Best regards, M.

entry.title: Re: Simplify Deployment and Monitoring with the CAP Console
entry.content: Hi @lechnerc77, thank you for your feedback! It's true that not all users will have the roles required to assign entitlements, enable the CF org, create a CF space etc. That's why we incorporated some checks for roles required to perform these actions, so we basically mirror what the user can and can not do in the BTP cockpit. We might have missed some roles checks, so if you encounter any specific bugs, please share them!

entry.title: Re: Transformation from DTAZV to pain 001.001.09 New EBS...
entry.content:
Solution: After applying the note(2253571), you may still encounter errors when validating the XML file using the bank‚Äôs validator. These errors are usually related to specific XML tags that do not fully match the bank‚Äôs required format.

To address this, additional customizing in DMEE is required. Adjust or map the XML tags that are causing validation errors according to the bank‚Äôs specifications. Once the DMEE tree is aligned with the bank requirements, the XML file should pass the validation successfully.

entry.title: Re: Individual QM order not created with inspection lot
entry.content:
Hi,

So I was checking some more and found the solution for that problem.

On the order level we needed to use account assignment category K.

Than when the business area , cost center are assigned during GR system will automatically perform the account assignment to inspection lot and create QM order. In other cases due to lack of data order is not created.

entry.title: Re: Observability for third party components components using SAP Cloud ALM

But you would need this docker container to be reachable from the service you want to instrument, and I am not sure if this is possible.

entry.title: Principal propagation from SAP Digital Manufacturing Production Process towards S/4HANA public cloud
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am working on a requirement that needs a custom production process in SAP Digital Manufacturing calling an SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Cloud OData api. I have followed the steps as mentioned in this blog post external-api-web-service-integration-with-sap-digital-manufacturing .

Here is my BTP destination in the subaccount where DM is subscribed.

tokenServiceURLType=Dedicated
audience=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
authnContextClassRef=urn\:oasis\:names\:tc\:SAML\:2.0\:ac\:classes\:X509
includeSigningCertificateInSAMLAssertion=false
tokenServiceUser=ZS4H_DMC_COMM
tokenServiceURL=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/bc/sec/oauth2/token
skipUserUuidInSAMLAttributes=false
URL=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata4/sap/zapi_productionorder_labels/srvd_a2x/sap/zser_mfg_label/0001
Name=S4-Dev-Label-api-pp
tokenServicePassword=<removed>
Type=HTTP
clientKey=ZS4H_DMC_COMM
Authentication=OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion
nameIdFormat=urn\:oasis\:names\:tc\:SAML\:1.1\:nameid-format\:emailAddress
skipUserAttributesPrefixInSAMLAttributes=false
ProxyType=Internet
userIdSource=
SAMLAssertionProvider=DestinationServiceGenerated

I have created the communication arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud:

 

But when I test the production process which uses the service thus created is not working, i.e., failing with HTTP 401

The production process worked successfully when I had used basic authentication at the BTP destination.

So, does SAP DM support such principal propagation with destination using OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion? Or where am I going wrong?

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Re: Simplify Deployment and Monitoring with the CAP Console
entry.content:
@Vincentius my point is not that the adding of entitlements and creation of services is safeguarded by roles, but I have doubts about the usage in a productive scenario.

The existance of this feature implies that this approach is a good practice when developing apps on SAP BTP. I have serious doubts that it is besides sandbox/experimentation/trial scenarios. Of course it depends on the setup at a customer and their definition of shared responsibilities between a platform/ops/admin and a dev team, but in the majority of sceanrios I have seen this is not considered as a good practice.

entry.title: Re: Does the "Menu" button in the tab strip not fire chan...
entry.content:
Hi,

events are only fired for actions which cause an interaction with the application (server).
"Cancel" will cause a roundtrip to the application - SAP GUI sending the respective vKey to the server and the application reacts accordingly. However, all options from the menu which are not related to the application, but to SAP GUI itself (like calling options dialog) do not cause events and do not have to, because this is pure SAP GUI stuff which cannot be automated via SAP GUI Scripting anyway and which does not need any interaction with the application.

Best regards,
Frank

entry.title: Re: Integrate My Inbox link to SAP Flexible Workflow E-Mail notification
entry.content:
Hello, 

I think from an Clean Extensibility perspective, it is not recommended to extend C_WORKFLOWTASK. It is used in many standard templates and the End User Text label indicates it as: "DEPRECATED: Work item with text info" (as of S4 PCE 2023 FPS03)

Instead I would follow the recommendation in SAP note 3115396 and create an application-specific e-mail template based on my own CDS view. 

In SE80, you can create you own e-mail template, define your CDS view and set in Eclipse + ADT the API state to C1 released. Then your e-mail template will show up in the FIORI app for E-Mail templates as predelivered template and you can take it from there. 

Note to set the API state, only click once in the Eclipse-tree on it (In case you double click, then it opens in the Eclipse integrated GUI and it will not show the API state in Properties). 

Best regards,
Stefan

entry.title: Re: Simplify Deployment and Monitoring with the CAP Console
entry.content:
@lechnerc77 fair point, CAP Console is definitely not suitable for all use cases. Customers with a more complex setup will probably also prefer to use a pipeline rather than CAP Console for deployment. Currently we are more focused on initial deployments, demos and experimentation rather than productive deployments.

Will try to communicate this more clearly in the future, so customers do not assume that CAP Console is a best practice for productive deployments.

entry.title: Re: Syntax error snote
entry.content:
My answer is generic to any problem when installing a note with SNOTE:

  1. SNOTE automatically retrieves all the prerequisite SAP notes.
  2. Make sure you applied the manual instructions indicated in the SAP notes.
  3. Make sure you have installed all the SAP notes related to SNOTE (in case there's a bug with SNOTE).
  4. It may happen, but it's rare, that there's a problem with very recent SAP notes. In that case, contact SAP Support.

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA SQL Script : substring the string
entry.content:
You could use SUBSTRING_REGEXPR function. Here is an example

WITH MyDummyData AS (
    SELECT '1/22' AS input_string FROM DUMMY
    UNION ALL
    SELECT '221/22/333/4444' AS input_string FROM DUMMY
)
SELECT 
    input_string,
    SUBSTRING_REGEXPR('[^/]+$' IN input_string) AS extracted_value
FROM MyDummyData

entry.title: Need access to reporting section in SAP for Me to view the utilization of licenses and resources
entry.content:
To access Reporting - SAP for Me, it is necessary for your S-user to have the "Display Support Situation Reporting" authorization. 

Here are the steps to request the appropriate authorization:  

How to request an S-user authorization: 

Contact your Super Administrators to assign you the required authorizations on the correct level. If you don't know the administrators at your company, visit Access and Authorizations (part "Who is my administrator?"). Alternatively use the Self-Service Authorization Request as documented in KBA‚ÄØ2891528. After you submit your request, the Super administrator will only need to approve it.

For additional details, you may refer to the documentation in KBA 3336856 - How to access Customer Insights Dashboard - SAP for Me

If you have any further questions or need additional assistance, please let me know.  

Best Regards,  
SAP Support
